page.title: 16Heather through the Years
page.content: Most men walked or rode a bicycle, but in 1932 I was about the fifth person to have a car. My friend took me in a side-car of his motorbike to Coventry to buy a Morris. I had never been in a car, but there was no driving-test in those days, so I got in and had to learn how to drive it on the way home. Up to 1932, Heather had a Mill and the corn was ground using power created by a dam in the river. When I was at school, we played football in Main Street! One day a boy was knocked down by a horse and trap! It would be unwise to play football there today, as Main Street and all the other roads through Heather are so busy.
